Define Project Goals and Objectives.task: Conduct a Stakeholder Meeting to Gather Requirements
Define Project Goals and Objectives.instructions: Organize a meeting with key stakeholders to collect their requirements and expectations for the project.
Define Project Goals and Objectives.approach: Create a detailed agenda, invite relevant stakeholders, and use a requirements gathering template to document their inputs.

Define Project Goals and Objectives.instructions: Develop a project charter document that defines the project's purpose, scope, and key deliverables.
Define Project Goals and Objectives.approach: Use a project charter template and include sections for project purpose, objectives, scope, key stakeholders, and deliverables.

Define Project Goals and Objectives.instructions: Establish measurable KPIs that will be used to evaluate the project's success.
Define Project Goals and Objectives.approach: Identify key project outcomes and define specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) KPIs.

Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.task: Collaborate with Stakeholders to Gather User Stories
Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.instructions: Work with stakeholders to collect user stories and requirements for the product backlog.
Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.approach: Use user story templates to document stakeholder needs and ensure all stories are complete.

Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.task: Use Techniques like MoSCoW for Prioritization
Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.instructions: Prioritize backlog items using the MoSCoW method to determine their importance.
Create and Prioritize the Product Backlo.approach: Categorize items as Must have, Should have, Could have, and Won't have using a prioritization matrix.

Daily Stand-up Meetings.instructions: Hold daily stand-up meetings to discuss progress, plans, and any blockers.
Daily Stand-up Meetings.approach: Follow a structured agenda where each team member answers three questions: What did I do yesterday? What will I do today? Are there any blockers?

Daily Stand-up Meetings.task: Update Task Status on the Sprint Board
Daily Stand-up Meetings.instructions: Update the status of tasks on the sprint board to reflect current progress.
Daily Stand-up Meetings.approach: Use a visual tool like a Kanban board to track task progress.

Conduct Sprint Review.instructions: Showcase the completed work to stakeholders during the sprint review meeting.
Conduct Sprint Review.approach: Prepare a demo of the completed work and gather feedback.

Conduct Sprint Review.task: Gather Feedback on Designs and Functionality
Conduct Sprint Review.instructions: Collect feedback from stakeholders on the designs and functionality delivered during the sprint.
Conduct Sprint Review.approach: Use a structured feedback form to ensure all feedback is captured.

Charts for Monitoring and Improvement.instructions: Use tools like burndown charts to monitor project progress.
Charts for Monitoring and Improvement.approach: Update the burndown chart daily to reflect the remaining work in the sprint.

Charts for Monitoring and Improvement.instructions: Use cumulative flow diagrams to visualize work in progress and identify bottlenecks.
Charts for Monitoring and Improvement.approach: Update the cumulative flow diagram regularly to monitor workflow and process efficiency.

Refine the Design Process.instructions: Put into practice the improvements that were identified during the sprint retrospectives.
Refine the Design Process.approach: Document action items from retrospectives and assign owners for each improvement.

Refine the Design Process.task: Regularly Update the Design System or Resource Library
Refine the Design Process.instructions: Keep the design system or resource library up-to-date with the latest best practices and assets.
Refine the Design Process.approach: Schedule regular reviews and updates of the design system.
